topicSummary: Obstructive sleep apnoea/hypopnoea syndrome (OSAHS) is the coexistence of excessive daytime sleepiness with irregular breathing at night.

topicHtmlObjects.htmlHeader: Obstructive sleep apnoea syndrome: Summary

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Information added to reflect the advice published in the Four-Week Wait Campaign: For the treatment of obstructive sleep apnoea syndrome (OSAS) OSA Partnership Group, 2015.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in October 2014 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key RCTs published since the last revision of this topic. The topic has undergone minor restructuring, and background information regarding sleep apnoea in children has been added. No major changes to the recommendations have been made.
